intro: Thelypodium salsugineum, commonly known as the common sandmat, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is a low-growing annual or biennial herb that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features basal leaves that are linear to oblanceolate in shape, often with a bluish or grayish hue due to a dense covering of trichomes. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers are arranged in racemate inflorescences, and it produces small, rounded pods that contain several seeds. Thelypodium salsugineum is native to Europe and western Asia and is often found in disturbed soils, roadsides, and open habitats.
